channel.title: Black box
channel.description: Whenever I put a different client background, it's always a black box around where you put ur login stuff. How can I make the black box look like the part of my client background?

item.title: Black box
item.dc:creator: @gangsta_tony gangsta tony
item.description:
@gangsta_tony wrote:

uhh, I don’t have a Sprites folder.

Read full topic

item.title: Black box
item.dc:creator: @recker450 recker450
item.description:
@recker450 wrote:

look in ./cache name/sprites
or just ./sprites

Read full topic

item.title: Black box
item.dc:creator: @gangsta_tony gangsta tony
item.description:
@gangsta_tony wrote:

Well I tried using a cache suite but when I click ‘Media’ nothing happened.

Read full topic

item.title: Black box
item.dc:creator: @revengr revengr
item.description:
@revengr wrote:

[quote=“gangsta tony, post:1, topic:359305”]Whenever I put a different client background, it’s always a black box around where you put ur login stuff. How can I make the black box look like the part of my client background?[/quote]In most cases (that I’ve seen), the login box can be edited in the client with a cache suite.
If this doesn’t make a difference, then the client loads the login box image from another folder.
But I haven’t worked with a client that does this, so I wouldn’t be able to tell you what the name of the file would be.

Read full topic
